verses.verse: There the prisoners rest together; (Job 39:7) They do not hear the voice of the oppressor.
The small and great are there, And the servant is free from his master.
“Why (Jer. 20:18) is light given to him who is in misery, And life to the (2 Kin. 4:27) bitter of soul,
Who (Rev. 9:6) long for death, but it does not come, And search for it more than (Prov. 2:4) hidden treasures;
Who rejoice exceedingly, And are glad when they can find the (Job 7:15, 16) grave?
Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden, (Job 19:8; Ps. 88:8; Lam. 3:7) And whom God has hedged in?
For my sighing comes before I eat, And my groanings pour out like water.
For the thing I greatly ((Job 9:28; 30:15)) feared has come upon me, And what I dreaded has happened to me.
I am not at ease, nor am I quiet; I have no rest, for trouble comes.”
Eliphaz: Job Has Sinned Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:
“If one attempts a word with you, will you become weary? But who can withhold himself from speaking?
Surely you have instructed many, And you (Is. 35:3) have strengthened weak hands.
Your words have upheld him who was stumbling, And you (Is. 35:3) have strengthened the feeble knees;
But now it comes upon you, and you are weary; It touches you, and you are troubled.
Is not (Job 1:1) your reverence (Prov. 3:26) your confidence? And the integrity of your ways your hope?
“Remember now, ((Job 8:20; 36:6, 7; Ps. 37:25)) who ever perished being innocent? Or where were the upright ever cut off?
Even as I have seen, ((Job 15:31, 35; Prov. 22:8; Hos. 10:13; Gal. 6:7)) Those who plow iniquity And sow trouble reap the same.
By the blast of God they perish, And by the breath of His anger they are consumed.
The roaring of the lion, The voice of the fierce lion, And (Job 5:15; Ps. 58:6) the teeth of the young lions are broken.
(Job 29:17; Ps. 34:10) The old lion perishes for lack of prey, And the cubs of the lioness are scattered.
“Now a word was secretly brought to me, And my ear received a whisper of it.
